intro: Praravinia sericotricha, commonly known as the hairy prairie violet, is a herbaceous plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. Praravinia sericotricha thrives in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
